intro: Rubus gattingeri, commonly known as the Gättinger bramble, is a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is native to Europe and is characterized by its thorny stems and clusters of white to pink flowers. The plant produces edible berries that are typically small and tart, often used in local cuisines. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges and hedgerows. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
